issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
On 3.0 and 3.1 it appears that volumes which are created from a snapshot for bfEBS instances have incorrect permissions, compared to all other volumes in /var/lib/eucalytpus/volumes

Output from euca-describe-volumes:

VOLUME  vol-777D456C     20     snap-C35240BB   cluster01       in-use  2012-07-23T17:46:44.935Z
ATTACHMENT      vol-777D456C    i-550A427C      /dev/sda1       attached        2012-07-23T17:46:45.106Z
VOLUME  vol-B6FC402F     20     snap-C35240BB   cluster01       in-use  2012-07-25T15:37:08.3Z
ATTACHMENT      vol-B6FC402F    i-82CD4318      /dev/sda1       attached        2012-07-25T15:37:08.533Z
VOLUME  vol-D44F4080     20     snap-C35240BB   cluster01       in-use  2012-07-24T12:08:38.46Z
ATTACHMENT      vol-D44F4080    i-9DB2406A      /dev/sda1       attached        2012-07-24T12:08:38.622Z

There are all volumes for bfEBS.  Next we check /var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes:

total 142121408                                                                                                                                                                                                     
drwx------ 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus       16384 Jul 20 12:05 lost+found                                                                                                                                              
-rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus  4294967296 Jul 20 12:07 snap-6E333F3C                                                                                                                                           
-rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 21474836480 Jul 20 12:13 snap-C35240BB                                                                                                                                           
-rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus  4299161600 Jul 20 12:14 vol-10693E6C                                                                                                                                            
-rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 21479030784 Jul 20 12:45 vol-15E541F0                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
-rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 21479030784 Jul 20 12:23 vol-3F873E4B                                                                                                                                            
*-rw-r--r-- 1 root       root       21479030784 Jul 23 10:46 vol-777D456C*                                                                                                                                            
*-rw-r--r-- 1 root       root       21479030784 Jul 25 08:37 vol-B6FC402F*                                                                                                                                          
-rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus  2151677952 Jul 20 12:28 vol-BCBB43B9                                                                                                                                            
*-rw-r--r-- 1 root       root       21479030784 Jul 24 05:08 vol-D44F4080*                                                                                                                                            
-rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus  2151677952 Jul 20 12:28 vol-E2B341BD
-rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus  3225419776 Jul 21 01:42 vol-F6913A33
fields.summary: Volumes created from a snapshot for bfEBS have incorrect filesystem permissions

comments.body: Should note that this doesn't appear to effect deletion of the volume when the bfEBS instance is terminated with deleteOnTerminate being true.

In an effort to reproduce this issue, I noticed on my HA cloud, that the volumes created by the SC all have the ownership of root.

{code}
[root@viking-03 ~]# ls -ail /var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/
total 73260452
128 drwx------   2 eucalyptus eucalyptus        4096 Aug  4 15:16 .
  2 dr-xr-xr-x. 23 root       root              4096 Jul 31 03:27 ..
133 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root        3221225472 Jul  7 16:42 snap-C32A426A
135 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root       19327352832 Aug  1 17:38 snap-DA5B3E9E
152 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root        5372903424 Jul 20 18:21 vol-2F154638
144 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root        3225419776 Jul  8 15:39 vol-2F634003
148 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root        3225419776 Jul 20 16:12 vol-6FB144AC
151 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root        5372903424 Jul 20 18:21 vol-716F3E3F
153 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root        5372903424 Jul 20 18:22 vol-AA4D447C
134 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root       19331547136 Aug  4 15:16 vol-AE4D3F6B
132 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root       19331547136 Aug  1 16:40 vol-C5103EAE
131 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root       19331547136 Aug  1 15:58 vol-F8C93EC0
{code}

This does not seem to be affecting the behavior of my cloud, because I can create and delete volumes.  I deleted volume *vol-716F3E3F* and got the following:

{code}
[root@viking-01 ~]# euca-describe-volumes 
VOLUME	vol-C5103EAE	 18		enter-the-wu	available	2012-08-01T23:40:53.742Z
VOLUME	vol-F8C93EC0	 18		enter-the-wu	in-use	2012-08-01T22:58:11.374Z
ATTACHMENT	vol-F8C93EC0	i-6E953B17	/dev/sdd	attached	2012-08-01T23:01:17.375Z
VOLUME	vol-AE4D3F6B	 18	snap-DA5B3E9E	enter-the-wu	deleting	2012-08-04T22:16:58.136Z
VOLUME	vol-716F3E3F	 5		enter-the-wu	available	2012-07-21T01:21:53.672Z
VOLUME	vol-2F154638	 5		enter-the-wu	available	2012-07-21T01:21:56.488Z
VOLUME	vol-AA4D447C	 5		enter-the-wu	available	2012-07-21T01:22:00.458Z
{code}

Deleting volume

{code}
[root@viking-01 ~]# euca-delete-volume vol-716F3E3F
VOLUME	vol-716F3E3F
{code}

File system on SC

{code}
[root@viking-03 ~]# ls -ail /var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/vol-716F3E3F
ls: cannot access /var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/vol-716F3E3F: No such file or directory
[root@viking-03 ~]# ls -ail /var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/
total 82458008
128 drwx------   2 eucalyptus eucalyptus        4096 Aug  4 15:25 .
  2 dr-xr-xr-x. 23 root       root              4096 Jul 31 03:27 ..
133 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root        3221225472 Jul  7 16:42 snap-C32A426A
135 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root       19327352832 Aug  1 17:38 snap-DA5B3E9E
152 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root        5372903424 Jul 20 18:21 vol-2F154638
144 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root        3225419776 Jul  8 15:39 vol-2F634003
148 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root        3225419776 Jul 20 16:12 vol-6FB144AC
153 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root        5372903424 Jul 20 18:22 vol-AA4D447C
134 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root       19331547136 Aug  4 15:16 vol-AE4D3F6B
132 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root       19331547136 Aug  1 16:40 vol-C5103EAE
131 -rw-r--r--   1 root       root       19331547136 Aug  1 15:58 vol-F8C93EC0
{code}

Status of volume

{code}
[root@viking-01 ~]# euca-describe-volumes 
VOLUME	vol-C5103EAE	 18		enter-the-wu	available	2012-08-01T23:40:53.742Z
VOLUME	vol-F8C93EC0	 18		enter-the-wu	in-use	2012-08-01T22:58:11.374Z
ATTACHMENT	vol-F8C93EC0	i-6E953B17	/dev/sdd	attached	2012-08-01T23:01:17.375Z
VOLUME	vol-AE4D3F6B	 18	snap-DA5B3E9E	enter-the-wu	deleting	2012-08-04T22:16:58.136Z
VOLUME	vol-716F3E3F	 5		enter-the-wu	deleted	2012-07-21T01:21:53.672Z
VOLUME	vol-2F154638	 5		enter-the-wu	available	2012-07-21T01:21:56.488Z
VOLUME	vol-AA4D447C	 5		enter-the-wu	available	2012-07-21T01:22:00.458Z
{code}

From my understanding, all directories used by a Eucalyptus component is suppose to have the ownership of *eucalyptus:eucalyptus*.  Has this behavior changed?

What user id / account were these volumes created with ? 

If I look at volumes created the User Console that are owned by euca:

{noformat}

[root@b-19 var]# ls -ail /var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/
total 28837936
525354 drwx------.  2 eucalyptus eucalyptus        4096 Dec  4 23:06 .
525303 drwxr-xr-x. 13 eucalyptus eucalyptus        4096 Dec  4 23:06 ..
525805 -rw-r--r--   1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 10737418240 Nov 19 11:10 snap-B1F83F6F
525768 -rw-r--r--   1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 10741612544 Nov 19 10:17 vol-6BAF3D38
525772 -rw-r--r--   1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 10741612544 Nov 19 11:18 vol-ADC23EA3


{noformat}

I suspect if you use the euca tools as root, the volumes end up as root.

notes: When volumes are snapshot-ed, all the setup and creation phase is wrapped in the euca-wrapper executable which is seturid . The ownership is going to be root. The euca-create-volume cli
invokes overlayManager.java:
	private String createFile(String fileName, long size) throws EucalyptusCloudException {
		if(!DirectStorageInfo.getStorageInfo().getZeroFillVolumes()).

Functionally, having root ownership should not be a problem, but the question is whether we *must* have root or if eucalyptus:eucalyptus will work. If it will work without root then we should not use roo. I think cause currently is simply that some commands that eucalyptus issues must be done as root so it simply uses the rootwrapper for everything including file creation.

A way to test it without root is simply to remove the EUCA_ROOT_WRAPPER parameter in OverlayManager for the file creation operation (a 'dd') in OverlayManager.createFile(). I give no guarantee it will still work, but we can give it a try. If it creates, attach, detach, deletes okay then we can probably remove the root requirement for the file itself.

If possible it would be preferable to not have root ownership of anything not strictly requiring it.

Posted dev/jpdonnelly/EUCA-3119 for review .

Passed Smoke test: http://qa-server.eucalyptus-systems.com/euca-qa/display_test.php?testname=SMOKE-&uid=1000&prev_page=&Refresh=Refresh

[~jdonnelly] my only concern is the snapshot and snapshot->volume operations. It looks like the BfEBS part of the smoke test failed when waiting on the instance to run, which involved a snap->vol creation. Can you confirm that euca-create-volume -z PARTI00 --snapshot snap-X works? I seem to recall some issues with LVM and doing the snapshots requiring root access to do the LVM snapshot, but I could be wrong.

If we can confirm that the snapshot and volume-from-snapshot ops work correctly then the fix looks good to go.

I will rerun the eucalyptus-3.2  eutest from source ; 
The ebs test failure is a phantom under the Smoke test;

passed 

{noformat}


[root@b-15 ~]# euca-describe-snapshots 
SNAPSHOT	snap-75FE3DB7	vol-200C3C92	completed	2012-12-19T19:28:26.731Z	100%	109927187929	4	None
[root@b-15 ~]# euca-create-volume -z cluster01 --snapshot snap-75FE3DB7
VOLUME	vol-16C83C1A	snap-75FE3DB7	cluster01	creating	2013-02-27T13:12:07.132Z

[root@b-15 ~]# euca-describe-volumes | grep C1A
VOLUME	vol-16C83C1A	 4	snap-75FE3DB7	cluster01	available	2013-02-27T13:12:07.132Z



{noformat}

{noformat}

Fix Verified: volumes from snapshots are always owned by eucalyptus
Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 3.2.2
Release     : 0.0.620.20130311gitb475dd6f.el6

{code}
[root@c-23 ~]# ls -ail /var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/
total 2099264
12058633 drwx------ 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus       4096 Mar 14 13:36 .
12058628 drwxr-xr-x 5 eucalyptus eucalyptus       4096 Mar 13 12:03 ..
12058737 -rw-r--r-- 1 root       root       1073741824 Mar 14 13:36 snap-38C33FDD
12058742 -rw-r--r-- 1 root       root       1073741824 Mar 14 13:36 snap-F97142A8
12058640 -rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 1077936128 Mar 14 13:33 vol-104F4032
12058638 -rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 1077936128 Mar 14 13:03 vol-16903CC0
[root@c-23 ~]# euca-describe-snapshots verbose
SNAPSHOT	snap-F97142A8	vol-104F4032	completed	2013-03-14T20:36:43.670Z	100%	150309829771	1	created by not eucalyptus user
SNAPSHOT	snap-38C33FDD	vol-16903CC0	completed	2013-03-14T20:36:13.189Z	100%	391527327992	1	None
[root@c-23 ~]# euca-create-volume -zPARTI00 --snapshot snap-38C33FDD
VOLUME	vol-40AE3ED3	snap-38C33FDD	PARTI00	creating	2013-03-14T20:42:03.801Z
[root@c-23 ~]# ls -ail /var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/
total 3148876
12058633 drwx------ 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus       4096 Mar 14 13:42 .
12058628 drwxr-xr-x 5 eucalyptus eucalyptus       4096 Mar 13 12:03 ..
12058737 -rw-r--r-- 1 root       root       1073741824 Mar 14 13:36 snap-38C33FDD
12058742 -rw-r--r-- 1 root       root       1073741824 Mar 14 13:36 snap-F97142A8
12058640 -rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 1077936128 Mar 14 13:33 vol-104F4032
12058638 -rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 1077936128 Mar 14 13:03 vol-16903CC0
12058744 -rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 1077936128 Mar 14 13:42 vol-40AE3ED3
{code}
Then created a volume from a snap of a user other than eucalyptus in the UI. After that the owner of the volumes is as follows:
{code}
[root@c-23 ~]# ls -ail /var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/
total 4198484
12058633 drwx------ 2 eucalyptus eucalyptus       4096 Mar 14 13:44 .
12058628 drwxr-xr-x 5 eucalyptus eucalyptus       4096 Mar 13 12:03 ..
12058737 -rw-r--r-- 1 root       root       1073741824 Mar 14 13:36 snap-38C33FDD
12058742 -rw-r--r-- 1 root       root       1073741824 Mar 14 13:36 snap-F97142A8
12058640 -rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 1077936128 Mar 14 13:33 vol-104F4032
12058638 -rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 1077936128 Mar 14 13:03 vol-16903CC0
12058744 -rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 1077936128 Mar 14 13:42 vol-40AE3ED3
12058745 -rw-r--r-- 1 eucalyptus eucalyptus 1077936128 Mar 14 13:44 vol-83644100
{code}
3.2.2 has been released, moving this to Resolved.
